name: nymphaea-foxfire
wildlife-value: Lily pads provide a landing place for thirsty bees, protection for pond life and the shading helps prevent algae growth.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
flower-description: These floating, pink and purple flowers are quite large (8-14 inches in diameter)! Flowers are yellow at the center, then pink, and then purple on the outer edge. Open stellate then mature to flat.
leaf-description: This plant has very large, floating leaves/ pads (24-30 inches in diameter!) in the shape of a plate. They are heavily mottled with burgundy or purple, appearing tie-dyed.
